snippet: On a live national broadcast each week, President Hugo Chávez, who is running for re-election, presents new dwellings to down-on-their-luck Venezuelans.
abstract: Venezuela's Pres Hugo Chavez maintains popular support, despite rampant crime, erratic basic services and stubborn poverty, with his housing giveaways financed by the country's vast oil income; Chavez, who is running for re-election, promotes the giveaways through the Housing Thursday broadcasts and television commercials that are essentially government-paid ads for his candidacy.

byline.contributor: María Eugenia Díaz contributed reporting from Caracas, Venezuela.

lead_paragraph: On a live national broadcast each week, President Hugo Chávez, who is running for re-election, presents new dwellings to down-on-their-luck Venezuelans.

headline.seo: In Venezuela, a Campaigning Chávez Builds Loyalty With House Giveaways
headline.print_headline: Building Loyalty With Bricks and Mortar
